text:
Hello everyone,
I'm a developer new to this platform.  Does anyone know if there are limitations on the amount of times you can use the menu() function on a single page?

We are having an issue where our secondary nav will not render on the client site, and occasionally the primary nav will be missing some items.  When we print the results of the function on the page, as you might expect the navs that aren't rendering are not returning results.  When we delete one of the menu function calls, then one of the 'later' functions will actually render and return results.  This is why we're wondering if there's a limit on the number of calls on menu()? Anyone experienced this before?
I've attached a photo of an example of the code just in case we are overlooking something, and I can also confirm that the menus do exists on the site.
Yep, those can be ignored. They're only needed for using Jinjava in a very particular way, that allows us to partially pre-render HubL.
Thanks Thomas! Actually, this module was a "clone" that I was trying to adapt which is why I had screwy code. I will give your recommendation a shot. Thanks so much!
ok, actually still stumped. Where do I put "object-fit: cover;"? Sorry, I am self taught and dont know code very well. :confused:
Can you share a preview page with me?

So you are using "img src" not background. All that background code probably isn't doing anything for you. I would start by commenting all that out (in .image-block) and see if anything changes I'm going to guess not. Then I would start by adding object fit there but you may need some other adjustments. Here is a good explanation of how it works. <https://css-tricks.com/on-object-fit-and-object-position/>
To comment out in HubSpot just highlight everything you want to disable then "mac" command / "win" control /
Ok, thanks so much again. I will take a look at this.
And very cool way to "comment out" - thanks!
Thanks Thomas! I got it to work. I appreciate your time and help on this.
No problem good luck with your project. Remember that you only use background css when applying it to a declared background image.
Thanks for all the responses folks :+1:
